summary: This is a 2007 email exchange between two Assistant U.S. Attorneys regarding a past case against Jeffrey Epstein involving the lease of a former embassy. One attorney requests information about the old case, and the other provides attached legal documents including a complaint, summary judgment brief, and court decisions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of a past legal case involving the lease of a former embassy, referenced by an Assistant U.S. Attorney seeking information about the case.

events.title: Inquiry about old Epstein case
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails a colleague asking for information about a past case against Jeffrey Epstein involving the lease of a former embassy.

events.title: Documents provided on Epstein case
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney responds to the inquiry by providing attached legal documents related to the old Epstein case, including complaint, summary judgment brief, and court decisions.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400 West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: The document reveals a 2007 email exchange between Assistant U.S. Attorneys discussing a past case against Jeffrey Epstein.
The case involved the lease of a former embassy, indicating Epstein's involvement in real estate or property transactions that attracted federal legal scrutiny.
Legal documents including a complaint, summary judgment brief, and court decisions were attached to the email, suggesting the case had progressed through significant legal stages.
The correspondence shows federal prosecutors were aware of and had worked on Epstein-related cases years before his 2008 arrest and subsequent prosecutions.
